definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
to gather up/to collect/to edit/to compile

sentences.english: Unlike a conventional editor-in-chief, Mr Wales has no staff.
sentences.chinese: 和傳統的總編輯不同，威爾士先生手下並無一兵一卒。

sentences.english: If one cannot be readily identified, address your letter to the editor-in-chief.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能找到合適的編輯，可將投稿信寫給總編輯。

sentences.english: This comes just weeks after Susan Toepfer was installed as the new editor-in-chief .
sentences.chinese: 而就在幾周前，蘇珊特普費爾是安裝新的總編輯。

sentences.english: He has been appointed editor in chief vice Mr.White,who has retired.
sentences.chinese: 他被任命爲總編輯，代替已退休的懷特先生。

sentences.english: No, I'm the chief editor of our English Publications Division.
sentences.chinese: 不，我是英語出版部的總編輯。

sentences.english: Zang Shan, chief editor of New Epoch Weekly, said that a property tax is not justified.
sentences.chinese: 是新紀囗元週報的總編輯，說房產稅是不合理的。

sentences.english: In addition to Ms. Hu, managing editor Wang Shuo also submitted his resignation, he said on Twitter.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，胡女士的總編輯王碩也提交了他的辭呈。

sentences.english: The following photo shows Zhu Ling, editor-in-chief of China Daily, delivering a speech.
sentences.chinese: 下圖爲中國日報社總編輯朱靈致辭。

sentences.english: Presently he is Virology Editor - in - Chief of'Veterinary Microbiology '.
sentences.chinese: 現在他是“獸醫微生物學”病毒學總編輯。

sentences.english: There are three editors-in-chief in the room.
The editor in chief was relieved from his post at the age of sixty-five.
sentences.chinese: 總編輯在六十五歲時被解除職務。

sentences.english: The resignation of the editor in chief was remarked upon by all the staff members in the newspaper office.
sentences.chinese: 報社的職員對總編輯的辭職議論紛紛。

sentences.english: The editor in chief docked some of the articles.
sentences.chinese: 總編輯刪節了某些文章。

sentences.english: Wang Shuo, Caijing's managing editor, said on his public Twitter page that he also had submitted his resignation, along with almost all other top editors.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，胡女士的總編輯王碩也提交了他的辭呈。

sentences.english: Worked for CCTV as a news editing and then became an editor of People's Daily.
sentences.chinese: 曾在中央電視臺做新聞編輯，後任人民日報總編輯。

sentences.english: The chief editor has just called in to say that he will leave for Shanghai this evening.
sentences.chinese: 總編輯剛纔打來電話說他今晚要去上海。

definition: chief editor (of newspaper)/abbr. for 總編輯|总编辑
vice-chairman (of an organization)/vice president (of a company)/deputy governor (of a bank)
head/director (of an organizational unit)/(police) commissioner/inspector-general/rank of local governor in Tang dynasty administration
deputy chair of board/vice-president (of a university etc)
